title: 820-00840 (1v on PPBus_G3H)
message:
Few notes about these transistors and ISL9239.

"En fase inicial el circuito de carga recibe solamente 5V desde el cargador.
En tal caso, U7000 controla los MOSFETs Q7030/40 en configuracion de Boost Converter (step-up).
Q1 queda siempre cerrado (ON) y Q3/4 realizan las funciones de conmutacion SMPS; Q2 queda abierto (OFF), no interviene.
En modo step-up, U7000 puede generar 13V en F7000 incluso con 5V de entrada en puerto USB-C.

Una vez que SMC empieza a trabajar y detecta el cargador correcto, U7000 controla los MOSFETs Q7030/40 en configuracion de Buck Converter (step-down).
Q4 queda siempre cerrado (ON) y Q1/2 realizan las funciones de conmutacion SMPS; Q3 queda abierto (OFF), no interviene.
La tension del cargador en este modo no es necesariamente de 20V, como aparece en esquema.
Segun la potencia real del cargador, puede entregar una tension de 15V, o 20V."

Easy to translate from spanish, for anyone I hope...

title: 820-00840 (1v on PPBus_G3H)
message:
Translated


"In the initial phase the charging circuit receives only 5V from the charger. In this case, U7000 controls the Q7030 / 40 MOSFETs in Boost Converter configuration (step-up). Q1 is always closed (ON) and Q3 / 4 perform the SMPS switching functions; Q2 remains open (OFF), does not intervene. In step-up mode, U7000 can generate 13V on F7000 even with 5V input on the USB-C port. Once SMC starts working and detects the correct charger, U7000 controls the Q7030 / 40 MOSFETs in Buck Converter configuration (step-down). Q4 is always closed (ON) and Q1 / 2 perform the SMPS switching functions; Q3 remains open (OFF), does not intervene. The charger voltage in this mode is not necessarily 20V, as shown in the diagram. Depending on the actual power of the charger, it can deliver a voltage of 15V, or 20V. "

____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

So based off that information the ISL9239 should power up PPBUS without the SMC's input?
